page.title: 09Kettlesing - The Land
page.content: Agriculture is the primary "industry" of the block, being mainly dairying with fodder and cereal crops (mainly barley), some beef cattle, and sheep on the higher moorland tops, e.g., Menwith Hill. Soil is a medium loam, with gentle valley slopes giving well-drained and excellent pasture. The acidic peat of the moorland top is ideal for rough grazing, especially sheep. Average farm size is 75-125 acres, being mainly family-owned and oper- ated, with settlement going back many generations. The proximity of densely populated areas gives a ready market for milk production.
